meanings.definition: A system of mutual suretyship and responsibility among the members of a tithing in early England.
meanings.sent1: In early England, frankpledges helped ensure everyone in the tithing looked out for each other.
meanings.sent2: The concept of frankpledges promoted a sense of community and shared responsibility.
meanings.sent3: The frankpledges in the tithing had a potluck every month to strengthen their bond.
meanings.sent4: The frankpledges were like a safety net, catching anyone who stumbled.
meanings.sent5: The idea of frankpledges was like a web connecting everyone in the community together.

meanings.definition: To pledge or guarantee something openly and honestly.
meanings.sent1: I will frankpledge my support for the charity event next week.
meanings.sent2: She frankpledges to always speak the truth no matter what.
meanings.sent3: He frankpledges to bring the best snacks to the party.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was frankpledged with a promise sealed by a handshake.
meanings.sent5: The team captain frankpledged to lead by example and never give up.
